info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 18 at 10:29AM CDT until March 18 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN CRENSHAW COUNTY... At 1029 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Brantley, or 9 miles south of Luverne, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado, destructive winds up to 80 mph, and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Glenwood around 1040 AM CDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
